channel.title: Frame on OpenSees Gallery
channel.description: Recent content in Frame on OpenSees Gallery

item.title: Chopra 10.4: Eigen Analysis
item.description: Eigen analysis of a two-storey shear frame This example demonstrates how to perform eigenvalue analysis and plot mode shapes. Idealized two-storey shear frame (Example 10.

item.title: Ex1: Time History Analysis of a 2D Elastic Cantilever Column
item.description: This example demonstrates how to perform time history analysis of a 2D elastic reinforced concrete cantilever column with a gravity load included in the analysis.

item.title: Example 3: Portal Frame Examples
item.description: This set of examples covers the nonlinear analysis of a reinforced concrete frame. The nonlinear beam column element with a fiber discretization of the cross section is used in the model.

item.title: Example 4: Multibay Two Story Frame
item.description: In this example the use of variable substitution and the Tcl loop control structure for building models is demonstrated. Example 4.

item.title: Example 5: Three-Dimensional Rigid Frame
item.description: Example 5.1 A three-dimensional reinforced concrete rigid frame, is subjected to bi-directional earthquake ground motion. Example5.1.tcl RCsection.tcl Or for Python:

item.title: Force-based Element vs. Displacement-based Element
item.description: Investigate the two most commonly used OpenSees elements for modeling beam-column elements: the force-based element (FBE) and displacement-based element (DBE).
